head.title: Brecksville Broadview Heights City School District

form.name: form1

div.span:
Brecksville - Broadview Heights City School District
6638 Mill Road | Brecksville, OH 44141

div.a: Brecksville Broadview Heights City School District

h3.span: Class of 2020 Honored During In-Car Ceremony at High School Stadium

div.span: As a culmination to the District’s weeklong illumination of the High School stadium lights at 8:20 p.m., which is “2020” in military time, The Brecksville-Broadview Heights City School District honored its graduating senior Class of 2020 Friday night from 8 p.m. until 8:20 p.m. with a special, socially distanced and commemorative ceremony

h3.span: Stadium Lights Will Illuminate Each Night This Week from 8 p.m. – 8:20 p.m.

div.span: The lights of Brecksville-Broadview Heights High School Stadium will illuminate every night this week, Monday, April 13th – Friday, April 17th from 8 p.m. until 8:20 p.m., which is “2020” in military time, to honor and recognize the BBHCSD Class of 2020 and our spring sport athletes.

h3.span: BBHCSD Robotics Team Puts to Use Makerspace Tools to Create Plastic Face Shields

div.span: The Brecksville-Broadview Heights High School Robotics team has taken their creative, hands-on and critical thinking skills and put them to relevant and necessary use in the last several days, helping to create plastic face masks for essential workers and businesses.

h3.span: New Student Online Registration for 2020-21 School Year to Open on Wednesday, April 15th

span.span: The Brecksville-Broadview Heights City Schools will be providing a convenient, fully online new student registration process beginning at 8:00 AM on Wednesday, April 15, 2020.

h3.span: Congratulations to BBHCSD for Being Named Best Communities for Music Education Award

div.span: Congratulations to the Brecksville-Broadview Heights City Schools for earning the renowned ‘Best Communities for Music Education Award,’ for 2020, by the National Association of Music Merchants (NAMM).
Bee Pride is currently being celebrated during the week of March 30th, Bee One Community Week, and the BBHCSD thanks the parents and students for their enthusiastic support.

h3.span: Governor Extends School Closure Through May 1st

div.span: Ohio Governor Mike DeWine extended the school closure period through Friday, May 1st for all public, private and charter schools during his daily press conference earlier today.

h3.span: BEE ONE COMMUNITY CHALLENGE, WEEK OF MARCH of 30TH!

div.span: As a pride-filled celebration of the quick and efficient transition everyone has made during the ordered school closure period, the BBHCSD is encouraging everyone to participate in our BEE ONE COMMUNTIY CHALLENGE WEEK next week (March 30th – April 3rd) by embracing an opportunity to Bee One Community, and participate in one or more of these daily activities next week.
